channel.title: My Commercial for school =/
channel.description:
So i needed to make a commercial for a [b]Parking place[/b]..... i've to promote it in a video, but the Parking place isn't done building yet XD
So it was kinda hard.
Oke here is my Concept: (Its crappy)
A boy that is acting like a badass, just got his drivers lisence and want to drive to a big city for his school, but then he finds out, how much traffic there is and how expensive the gas prices are, so he finds a solution!
P+R Meerhoven! (Parking+Riding)
Anyways, its a simple f*ked up concept, played by me xd (Ye u can laugh about my fat belly...)
Feedback please :rolleyes:
[youtube]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=O8wqEFxSSVE[/youtube]

item.title: My Commercial for school =/

I don’t think its bad at all

Read full topic

item.title: My Commercial for school =/
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

[quote=“oldschool-scape, post:6, topic:463146”]@ Lin, ye i know, i tried to get rid of most fades but sometimes i needed one, (Like those flashes because if i didnt i would get a Jump shot)[/quote]Exactly… Get rid of all of them. Walking looks very bad with any sort of fades. You don’t need to show the audience “Okay he is walking here… Now after 5 seconds of walking he is where you think he would be…”

EDIT: What I’m trying to say is you don’t need to show where the person is walking every step of the way. Skip it and cut to the next shot.

Read full topic

item.description:
@oldschool-scape wrote:

Ty for feedback

@ Fails, Same here xd but it is for school.

@ RandQm ty man

@ Lin, ye i know, i tried to get rid of most fades but sometimes i needed one, (Like those flashes because if i didnt i would get a Jump shot)

@ Bowser jr, To bad…

item.title: My Commercial for school =/
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

The first 10 seconds make me go away from the film, please change your music.

Read full topic

item.title: My Commercial for school =/
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

Avoid the fades. Always. Just cut to the next shot because no matter what you do, fades will almost always look unprofessional and pull the audience out of what’s going on to notice it - especially if it’s walking.

(I took two years of a video production class and have made several videos)

Read full topic
